title: About Us
description: OpenLaw NZ is an open-source legal data platform. Our goal is to improve the accessibility of case law and other legal information in New Zealand. We want to make it easier for all New Zealanders to understand law.

group.content_html: OpenLaw NZ is an open-source legal data platform. Our goal is to improve the accessibility of case law and other legal information in New Zealand. We want to make it easier for all New Zealanders to understand law.
group.title: What Openlaw is

group.content_html: You can use our search to find case law, and navigate between related information. You can also use our plugins (or write your own) to aid your research.
group.title: Search

group.content_html: You can use our API to build case law intelligence into your own applications and services. For an example, see ourâ€¯chrome extension.
group.title: Chrome Extension

directors.name: Andrew Easterbrook, CEO
directors.bio: Andrew is a lawyer, and has worked in technology law, civil litigation and family law since 2009. He has been a Member of the Auckland District Law Society Technology & Law Committee since 2012, and is experienced in web and software development. Andrew went to university at Victoria, Wellington, and now lives in Whangarei.

directors.name: William Parry, CTO
directors.bio: William brings 15 years of tech experience across enterprise, advertising and small businesses including 8 years working with open data in projects and hackathons. He has run community coding classes and is passionate about empowering disadvantaged people with technology. William went to university at Victoria, Wellington, and now lives in Sydney.
